title: Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform
description:
Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform

Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applications

Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until restart.

Reproduced with Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021.

It appears to be a duplicate of issue Bug 46373.

Jetty guys seem to have fixed the problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel

I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
OB: With this logging, we can see that `selector.select(timeout)` sometimes returns zero keys on the Linux platform.
EB: When encountering this issue, multiple requests to the web application should be made (e.g., by continuously pressing F5 in the browser).
SR:
Follow these steps to reproduce:
1. Open the web application in a browser.
2. Press F5 repeatedly and hold the button to generate multiple requests.
3. Observe the server's CPU usage.
